summary: This document is an email chain from July 29, 2020, discussing a media inquiry from Bloomberg reporter Patricia Hurtado regarding a legal filing by Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers in the civil suit brought by Virginia Giuffre. The filing alleges prosecutors improperly obtained Maxwell's sealed deposition and that Giuffre's lawyers set a 'perjury trap' during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Patricia Hurtado
persons.context: A reporter from Bloomberg who sent an email inquiry to an unspecified recipient(s) seeking comment on allegations made in a legal filing by Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her lawyers filed a document in her civil case alleging improper conduct by prosecutors and a 'perjury trap' set during her 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: The plaintiff in the civil case (Guiffre v. Maxwell) who took Maxwell's deposition in April 2016, which is central to the alleged 'perjury trap'.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: The judge presiding over the civil case Guiffre v. Maxwell, to whom Maxwell's lawyers submitted the filing in question.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant and Giuffre is the plaintiff in the civil lawsuit Guiffre v. Maxwell.
Judge Preska is presiding over the civil case in which Maxwell is a defendant.

events.title: Media Inquiry Regarding Maxwell Filing
events.description: Bloomberg reporter Patricia Hurtado sends an email inquiry seeking comment on allegations made in a filing by Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition by Giuffre
events.description: Virginia Giuffre took Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition, which Maxwell's lawyers later alleged was a 'perjury trap' set in collaboration with the government.

events.title: Maxwell's Lawyers File Allegations
events.description: Maxwell's lawyers file a document (docket 1078) in the civil case alleging prosecutors improperly obtained her sealed testimony and that a 'perjury trap' was set during her 2016 deposition.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers alleged in a court filing that prosecutors improperly obtained her sworn testimony, which was supposed to be under seal.
Maxwell's lawyers alleged that Virginia Giuffre's lawyers, working with the government, set a 'perjury trap' for Maxwell during her deposition in April 2016.
The filing was submitted in the civil case Guiffre v. Maxwell (15-cv-7433) to Judge Preska.
A Bloomberg reporter sought comment on these allegations from an unspecified recipient, indicating media interest in the legal tactics and accusations within the case.
